Articles.Content: So any thoughts on what the science module might actually do?
Oooooooo, I hope its science, with rockets.

Hopefully now that 0.22 has been unveiled feature-wise at PAX, there will be a bit more detail (from testers with pre-releases maybe) in the weekly since the twitch stream was a bit, uhh, short (in both time, and detail).

Unfortunately 0.22 isn't in the testing phase yet, this is all very early development footage

There already is a CTRL-Z function. It undoes what you did.

I really want that science stuff. Sub assembly stuff will be good, but I can live without it if I get cool science stuff!

the ctrl-z doesn't work, at least when I try it never does anything, never has.

the ctrl-z doesn't work, at least when I try it never does anything, never has.

It's always worked as an undo command for me, for over a year.

the ctrl-z doesn't work, at least when I try it never does anything, never has.

CTRL-Z apparently cannot undelete parts. If you take something off your craft by mistake, put it to the side, press CTRL-Z and then delete the extraneous parts.
If you are on a mac, command z might work instead. Otherwise, don't know what the problem with your game is. To be honest, it would be nice if they did improve the control z function a bit, though.
Science...IN SPACEEEEEEEE!!! Have you seen those sweet sample containers? Could it be that resources are finally coming in .23?
I have a kool (yes) feeling that this will be better than 0.18 update! Devs,you rock!

That flying rocket NEEDS to be in the game.

Maybe after it finishes loading stuff, but before the main menu pops up.

The devs surprise me with new stuff every update.
what will happen with robotic probes?how will they do science.

what will happen with robotic probes?how will they do science.

According to the live stream, you might get a certain amount of "Science" for returning the probe, or another amount or type for transmitting data back to KSC (yes, the communications parts will have a real purpose finally).
Sounds like 0.22 will be the best update yet!
Every update is the best update yet, untill new update comes out. :-)
I mean the new features will be the best so far, even better than what 0.18 added to the game.

SCIENCE, finally!

"Let's start testing!"

Seriously though, the R&D will be a good addition to the game, as well as the sub-assembly. So, as I read here, there would be research points, that you can use to unlock tech, and the only way to get them is doing science then transmitting them back to Kerbin?

If that's so, then I can't wait for career mode!

Edited September 2, 2013 by AntonioAJC
Wait what? There's a new logo? Does anyone have a screenshot of it? I can't really watch video right now.

Wait what? There's a new logo? Does anyone have a screenshot of it? I can't really watch video right now.

Someone needs to make a gif of it to catch its greatness so we can show it here.

I just want science stuff for sandbox mode.... my rovers need more than just air pressure/temp gauges.... and drivering seats

I want mass spectometers, voltmeters, x-ray diffraction machines, and finally a big honking laser that can vapourise rocks from 10 feet (3 meters) away and sniff the resulting smoke

After all... if its on a NASA rover..... we need it on a KSP rover

Boris

"hmmm is the mun made of cheese? The kerbals demand an answer!!"
This game just gets better and better, it's inconceivable! I'm really digging the science parts, finally my rovers won't be left for dead or only used for easter eggs

I just want science stuff for sandbox mode.... my rovers need more than just air pressure/temp gauges.... and drivering seats

I want mass spectometers, voltmeters, x-ray diffraction machines, and finally a big honking laser that can vapourise rocks from 10 feet (3 meters) away and sniff the resulting smoke

After all... if its on a NASA rover..... we need it on a KSP rover

Boris

"hmmm is the mun made of cheese? The kerbals demand an answer!!"

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?

Bask in all it's glory....

(Best watched in 720 at full screen to simulate actual game play)

the ctrl-z doesn't work, at least when I try it never does anything, never has.

I would try to do a fresh reinstall if i were you. It has been working fine for me since at least .18.
Unfortunately it seems that the subassembly loader could use some work, but I am sure they will iron out the bugs.
Woo, science modules! Now when one of my probes crashes I can scream "THE HULL IS BREACHED AND THE SCIENCE IS LEAKING OUT!!!"
